meanings.definition: To pull or haul (a vehicle, boat, etc.) using a rope or chain.
meanings.sent1: I will tow the broken car to the mechanic.
meanings.sent2: The truck was able to tow the heavy load effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The little toy car decided to tow the big toy truck for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a strong rope, able to tow her through any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The tugboat's job is to tow large ships safely into the harbor.

meanings.sent1: The tow of the boat was smooth and steady.
meanings.sent2: He watched the tow of the car with interest.
meanings.sent3: The tow of the wagon made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The tow of the sled down the hill was exhilarating.
meanings.sent5: The tow of the airplane on the runway signaled the start of the journey.

meanings.definition: A rope or chain used for towing.
meanings.sent1: The tow was securely fastened to the back of the truck.
meanings.sent2: She always kept a spare tow in her vehicle for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The colorful tow was easy to spot in the garage.
meanings.sent4: The tow's strength was tested when pulling the heavy load.
meanings.sent5: The tow's durability was evident in its ability to withstand rough use.
